requirement_tested: Implement user authentication and authorization system
user_persona: A new user named Sarah who wants to register and access her domain leasing account.
user_goal: To successfully register for an account and log in to access the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Site
narrative_steps.description: Sarah visits the domain leasing website for the first time and sees the login form on the homepage.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Register' link below the login form.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The registration form with name, email, password, and confirm password fields appears.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Registration
narrative_steps.description: Sarah fills out her personal details and submits the registration form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in first name, last name, email, password, and confirm password fields. Click the 'Register' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system creates a new user account via authAPI and redirects Sarah to a confirmation page.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: After confirming her registration, Sarah returns to the homepage and attempts to log in with her new credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Enter email and password into the login fields. Click the 'Login' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system authenticates Sarah and redirects her to her user dashboard with a welcome message.

requirement_tested: Create domain search functionality with filtering and sorting options
user_persona: Alex, an entrepreneur looking for a suitable domain name for his new business.
user_goal: To find an available .com domain under $20, sorted by price.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Domains
narrative_steps.description: Alex enters keywords into the search bar and applies filters to narrow down his options.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'businesssolution' into the search bar. Select '.com' from TLD dropdown, set max price to $20, choose 'Available' status, and sort by 'Price Low to High'. Click 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page updates dynamically to show matching domains within Alex's criteria, ordered from lowest to highest price.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Results
narrative_steps.description: Alex scrolls through the filtered results to evaluate potential domains.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll through the grid of domain results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each result displays the domain name, price, and availability status clearly in a responsive grid layout.

requirement_tested: Develop domain leasing workflow with lease term selection
user_persona: Jamie, a small business owner interested in leasing a premium domain.
user_goal: To select a 2-year lease term with discount and proceed to checkout.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Domain Details
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on a premium domain to view its leasing options.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a domain card from the search results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The domain detail page loads, showing available lease terms as radio buttons with pricing information.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Lease Term
narrative_steps.description: Jamie selects the 2-year option to benefit from the discount.
narrative_steps.action: Click the '2 Years' radio button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The total cost updates instantly to reflect the discounted price for the 2-year term.

narrative_steps.title: Proceeding to Checkout
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with the selection, Jamie proceeds to finalize the lease.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Proceed to Checkout' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system initiates the lease transaction via leaseAPI and redirects Jamie to the payment page.

requirement_tested: Build domain renewal process with expiration date tracking
user_persona: Taylor, a long-term client who needs to renew an expiring domain.
user_goal: To renew a domain lease that expires soon.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Taylor logs in and checks the dashboard for upcoming expirations.
narrative_steps.action: Log into the account and navigate to the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard displays a list of leased domains including those nearing expiration with prominent renewal buttons.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Renewal
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the renewal button next to the expiring domain.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Renew' button for the domain expiring soon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up showing current lease details, extension options, and total cost for renewal.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Renewal
narrative_steps.description: Taylor confirms the renewal to extend the lease period.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Confirm Renewal' button in the modal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system processes the payment via renewalAPI, extends the lease period, and shows a success confirmation.

requirement_tested: Enable domain transfer request submission and processing
user_persona: Jordan, who wants to transfer a domain to another user.
user_goal: To initiate a domain transfer to a colleague.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Transfer Form
narrative_steps.description: Jordan navigates to the transfer section and begins initiating a transfer.
narrative_steps.action: Go to the domain detail page and click the 'Transfer Domain' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A transfer initiation form appears requiring recipient email and security code generation.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Transfer Request
narrative_steps.description: Jordan fills in the recipient's email and submits the request.
narrative_steps.action: Enter the recipient's email address and click 'Submit Transfer Request'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system generates a unique transfer code, sends a notification via transferAPI, and shows a confirmation message.

requirement_tested: Design user dashboard to display leased domains and leasing history
user_persona: Morgan, a frequent user wanting to review past transactions.
user_goal: To view all currently leased domains and past leasing activities.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Morgan logs in and goes straight to the dashboard to check domain status.
narrative_steps.action: Log in and land on the dashboard automatically.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard shows a grid of currently leased domains, upcoming expirations, and recent transactions timeline.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Transaction History
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks on a transaction entry to see more details.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a transaction item in the recent activity timeline.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The transaction expands to reveal full details including dates, amounts, and related actions like renewal or cancellation.

requirement_tested: Implement order management system for domain transactions
user_persona: Casey, a meticulous user who wants to track all orders.
user_goal: To view and filter all past orders by status.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Order Management
narrative_steps.description: Casey navigates to the order management section to review transactions.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Orders' link in the main navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The order management page loads with a sortable table showing order ID, type, date, amount, and status.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering Orders
narrative_steps.description: Casey uses filters to focus only on completed orders.
narrative_steps.action: Use the status filter dropdown to select 'Completed' and apply the filter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The displayed orders update in real-time via orderAPI to show only completed transactions.

requirement_tested: Integrate payment processing for leases, renewals and transfers
user_persona: Riley, ready to make a payment for a domain lease.
user_goal: To complete payment using PayPal for a selected domain lease.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Payment Method
narrative_steps.description: At checkout, Riley selects PayPal as the preferred payment method.
narrative_steps.action: On the checkout page, click the 'PayPal' payment method card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The PayPal input fields appear, and the order summary remains visible on the side.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Payment
narrative_steps.description: Riley fills in PayPal details and completes the transaction.
narrative_steps.action: Enter PayPal credentials and click 'Complete Purchase'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system processes the payment via paymentAPI, updates the order status to 'Completed', and redirects to a confirmation page.

requirement_tested: Create admin panel for managing users and domain inventory
user_persona: An administrator named Devon overseeing the platform.
user_goal: To update domain inventory information in the admin panel.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Panel
narrative_steps.description: Devon logs in with admin credentials and accesses the admin panel.
narrative_steps.action: Log in as admin and click on the 'Admin Panel' link in the navigation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The admin panel loads with a sidebar containing sections for Users, Domains, and Orders.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Domain Information
narrative_steps.description: Devon finds a domain and edits its resale value.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the Domains section. Click on a domain row to enable editing mode. Update the resale value field and save changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The domain record is updated via adminAPI, and a success message confirms the change was saved.

requirement_tested: Build responsive UI with old lace background and rosy brown component accents
user_persona: Pat, accessing the site from both desktop and mobile devices.
user_goal: To experience consistent styling and usability across different screen sizes.

narrative_steps.title: Desktop Experience
narrative_steps.description: Pat browses the site on a desktop computer and notices the color scheme.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage on a desktop browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The website features an old lace background with rosy brown borders, buttons, and accent elements throughout the interface.

narrative_steps.title: Mobile Responsiveness
narrative_steps.description: Pat switches to a mobile device to ensure usability.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate mobile view or access the site on a smartphone.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts fluidly to maintain usability with touch-friendly controls and readable text.

requirement_tested: Establish backend API endpoints for all frontend data requirements
user_persona: A developer named Quinn working on frontend integration.
user_goal: To verify that all required data is accessible via properly functioning API endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Domain Data
narrative_steps.description: Quinn makes a call to retrieve domain information for display.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to the '/api/v1/domains' endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API responds with a structured JSON payload containing domain data including pagination information.

narrative_steps.title: Handling Errors Gracefully
narrative_steps.description: Quinn tests how the API handles invalid requests.
narrative_steps.action: Send a malformed request to an endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API returns a standardized JSON error response with appropriate HTTP status code and descriptive message.

requirement_tested: Connect backend to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A DevOps engineer named Lee responsible for deployment.
user_goal: To ensure the application connects correctly to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Application
narrative_steps.description: Lee starts the backend server to verify database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Run the backend server startup command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The application initializes the PostgreSQL connection pool using the specified environment variables and validates connectivity before serving requests.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with npm run install:all and npm run dev scripts
user_persona: A new team member named Sam setting up the development environment.
user_goal: To easily install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Sam clones the repository and runs the installation script.
narrative_steps.action: Open terminal in project root and run 'npm run install:all'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dependencies for both frontend and backend are installed sequentially without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Sam starts both development servers with a single command.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers launch concurrently, allowing simultaneous development and testing.

requirement_tested: Implement domain information display with detailed specifications
user_persona: A researcher named Robin evaluating domain quality.
user_goal: To view comprehensive technical and ownership information for a domain.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Domain Info
narrative_steps.description: Robin clicks on a domain to see detailed specifications.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a domain name from the search results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The domain information page loads with tabbed sections for Technical Details, SEO Information, DNS Records, and Ownership History.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Technical Details
narrative_steps.description: Robin explores the technical aspects of the domain.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Technical Details' tab.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Relevant technical specifications load dynamically via domainInfoAPI without refreshing the page.

requirement_tested: Develop notification system for lease expirations and transaction updates
user_persona: A busy professional named Kai who relies on notifications.
user_goal: To stay informed about upcoming lease expirations and transaction updates.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Notifications
narrative_steps.description: Kai clicks the notification bell to review recent alerts.
narrative_steps.action: Click the notification bell icon in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown panel appears showing recent notifications with timestamps and unread indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Notification Details
narrative_steps.description: Kai clicks on a notification to get more information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a notification about an upcoming lease expiration.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The notification is marked as read, and Kai is redirected to the relevant domain or transaction page.
